required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY2605541 and Glargine on Fats in Participants With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Effects of LY2605541 on Triglyceride Metabolism, Compared to Insulin Glargine, in Patients With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration
Denmark: Danish Health and Medicines Authority

brief_summary.textblock: This study has two parts. Each participant will receive a daily injection of LY2605541 during one treatment period and a daily injection of insulin glargine during the other treatment period. Each treatment period is 3 to 4 weeks and is followed by procedures to look at how the body uses or stores fats while taking each study drug.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacodynamics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 22 of each treatment period from start of triglyceride metabolism assessment (TMA) procedure (time 0) up to 420 minutes
Day 22 of each treatment period from start of TMA procedure (time 0) up to 420 minutes
Day 22 of each treatment period from start of TMA procedure (time 0) up to 420 minutes
Day 22 of each treatment period from start of TMA procedure (time 0) up to 420 minutes

arm_group.description: Stable dose of LY2605541 (0.2 - 0.8 units per kilogram [U/kg]) administered subcutaneously (SQ) once daily for at least 21 days in one of two treatment periods. Dose based on prestudy basal insulin dosing regimen.
Stable dose of insulin glargine (0.2 - 0.8 U/kg) administered SQ once daily for at least 21 days in one of two treatment periods. Dose based on prestudy basal insulin dosing regimen.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetic for more than 1 year with glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) of less than 8.5%
- Otherwise fit and healthy
- Non smoker
Exclusion Criteria:
- Taking medication or supplements other than insulin to control diabetes.
- Suffered a hypoglycemic event in the last 12 months that required hospitalization or have poor awareness of hypoglycemia
- Taking fibrates, thyroid replacement therapy, testosterone, beta blockers or systemic corticosteroids
